meanings.definition: To form blisters on the skin
meanings.sent1: The hot sun can blister your skin if you stay out too long.
meanings.sent2: The burn from the stove caused his hand to blister quickly.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally blistered her fingers while cooking dinner.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the fire blistered the paint on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The harsh chemicals in the cleaning solution can blister your hands if not used carefully.

meanings.definition: A small bubble on the skin filled with serum and caused by friction, burning, or other damage
meanings.sent1: She carefully popped the blister on her heel to relieve the pressure.
meanings.sent2: The blister on his thumb made it difficult to hold a pencil.
meanings.sent3: The blister on her lip from the hot soup made her pout comically.
meanings.sent4: The blister on the back of his neck throbbed with each movement.
meanings.sent5: The blister on her palm oozed clear liquid, a sign of healing.
